revised_title: Fracture of Brittle and Viscous Solids: The Influence of Shearing
tldr: The author investigates the fracture of brittle and viscous solids under shearing stress, discovering that softer materials tend to break parallel to the shearing surfaces, while harder materials exhibit a spiral fracture. This research supports Forbes's theory of glacier movement, which posits that shearing motion in glaciers leads to fissures parallel to the shearing surfaces.
